description: Fibonacci(prime(n)) mod prime(n), where prime(n) is the n-th prime.
comments: Terms are 1 when prime(n) == 1 or 4 mod 5, terms are prime(n)-1 when prime(n) == 2 or 3 mod 5.In general, it appears that Fibonacci(k*p) mod p = Fibonacci(k) or p-Fibonacci(k) for prime p > Fibonacci(k). For example Fibonacci(8*29) mod 29 = 21. - _Gary Detlefs_, May 28 2014
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
R. Peele and P. Stanica, Matrix powers of column-justified Pascal triangles and Fibonacci sequences, arXiv:math/0010186 [math.CO], 2000.
prog: (PARI) vector(80, n, fibonacci(prime(n)) % prime(n)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 15 2015
author: _Jud McCranie_, Dec 11 1999
